abstract: Saab Automobile and two subsidiaries filed for “voluntary reorganization” to buy time until planned investments from Chinese companies materialize.
snippet: Saab Automobile and two subsidiaries filed for “voluntary reorganization” to buy time until planned investments from Chinese companies materialize.
lead_paragraph: PARIS — The Swedish carmaker Saab, awaiting investments from companies in China, sought court protection from creditors on Wednesday, heading off a legal challenge from unions that could have forced the breakup of the company.

headline.main: Saab Files for Court Protection While It Awaits Chinese Cash
headline.print_headline: Countering Unions, Saab Seeks Creditor Protection
